attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Stop/ reduce the financial requirement in immigration -It's breaking up families
attributes.background: Financial requirements are too high and minimum wage is too low. Lower the financial criteria to minimum wage or get rid of it. Families are being broken by the Home Office as they are deporting genuine family members out of the UK and creating skype families.
attributes.additional_details: You need to earn £18,600 for a spouse visa. When there's a child involved and the member of the family has no working rights, the financial criteria is impossible to reach. It’s destroying lives and making people mentally ill.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Free school meals for everyone including secondary school students.
attributes.background: Many parents work extremely hard whilst caring for their children and lunch fees can become expensive, especially when the number of children they have increase. So free school meals can help them save money and maintain the family.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: Make Sileby Train station more accessible.
attributes.background: Our community wants better access to Sileby train station so that wheelchair users, individuals who have mobility issues and individuals who have children in pushchairs. There are many steps going up to the platform. Therefore wheelchairs, pushchairs and those who cannot manage steps cannot access.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: Re-introduce National Service
attributes.background: For the good of the country and it’s people, bring back National Service.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Mandatory right for substance misuse clients to have an independent advocate
attributes.background: We want it to be a statutory right for people with substance misuse issues to have access to an independent advocate, like other types of patients in the Mental Health Act 2010. We feel this will allow dual diagnosis clients who can't access mental health services better access to support networks.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of people with severe mental health issues have substance misuse issues.
37% of alcohol abusers have a mental health issue.
53% of drug users also have mental health issues.
These people cant access independent advocates through the mental health act because mental health services want these people to deal with their addictions before they commence treatment for mental health.

Figures from Helpguide.org

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: Stop male day old chicks being killed.
attributes.background: Millions of male chicks are killed every year. Because the industry has no monetary use for them. Once hatched they are sexed at one day old. Then separated to be ground to a pulp. Not very humane.
attributes.additional_details: All Battery hens are all female. So males have no use.

attributes.action: Address the quality of food being served to patients in NHS hospitals.
attributes.background:
The current state of food in both general and mental health hospitals is very poor. 
The fresh frozen produce being served across many NHS hospitals is costly, unappealing and wasteful. 
I believe that this needs to be addressed as it is impacting on people's physical and mental recovery.
attributes.additional_details:
I have seen first hand the quality of food which is served to patients and the amount of waste it creates.
 
When good quality food is fresh and appealing it has a massive impact on a patient’s recovery time which helps to reduce the time spent in hospital.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for any British politician to lie or deceive UK citizens
attributes.background: Politicians seem to be able to say what they want without being held to account, if there was some kind of criminal action that can be taken to insure a little bit more truth in their actions and words. Perhaps this force them to be honest with the British public.

attributes.action: Review eligibility(prior degree) for the Masters loan for the LLM Legal Practice
attributes.background: A long distance Masters degree, which I struggled to pay for in instalments, has now made me ineligible to apply for a Postgraduate loan to study the Legal Practice Course, which I need to become a solicitor. I now face trying to fund this course via expensive loans or not qualifying at all.
attributes.additional_details: Law graduates who struggled to privately fund a Masters as they could not afford the LPC, are not-eligible for the Post graduate loan. The LPC is the main practice course which enables them become Solicitors. The additional LLM on top of the Legal Practice Course(LPC) is an additional dissertation to qualify the LPC for the Masters Loan. I pray that the eligibilty rule which exempts Law graduates with a previous higher qualification from applying for a Masters loan to study the LPC be reviewed.

attributes.action: Ensure that there is a Mental Health nurse or doctor in every GP practice
attributes.background:
I feel as if the current system in place in GP surgeries is inadequate for the amount of people that are facing mental health issues in this country.

'At any time, one in six adults has a mental health condition and one in 100 has a severe mental illness.' (Nuffield Trust, 2015)
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience, I feel that you do not get the same level of care with a normal GP, as they are not necessarily trained across the mental health spectrum. They rush the 10 minute appointment because they have 100s of patients to see per day. This needs to change. There needs to be a dedicated member of staff for times of crisis, and for people that maybe need longer appointments to explain their issues.

attributes.action: Force all new build house purchases to have a retainer on purchase agreements.
attributes.background: More new build houses are being built each day. Problems with new builds are soaring and NHBC warranties is not enough to protect buyers. Developers should be force to accept retainer agreements from purchasers to protect them against nightmare builds, retaining part of funds until work is completed
attributes.additional_details: I am a new build homeowner. 8 months in to date. We have suffered unimaginable losses financially and also mentally due to a nightmare build. We have had drains incorrectly installed, we have a house that does not have building control sign off and we are still no where near getting our house right. I live on a street where 10 other residents also have houses that are not signed off from building control, yet we are living in these houses. The system is very very broken and people are suffering.

attributes.action: Oppose the death penalty for IS 'Beatles' duo
attributes.background: Whatever the crime, the UK government must oppose the death penalty as a matter of principle. A letter leaked to the Telegraph shows that the UK government would seek no assurances about the sentences of Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh if the pair were extradited to the US.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to protect civilians
attributes.background: Nigeria is a former colony and protectorate of the Imperial British Empire. Now it is an independent nation. There is a general insecurity fuelled by violence and killings. Action is required now to protect the Nigerian people and bring peace to the country.

attributes.action: Amend the PPERA 2000 to ban all foreign donations at all times
attributes.background:
The UK currently allows foreigners to donate to political causes and campaigns. The PPERA allows this outside of election campaigns, which gives foreign money undue influence in United kingdom political life.

The PPERA 2000 should be amended to ban all such at all times

attributes.action: Stop paying tax on pensions
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that paying tax on private and other pensions is unfair given that people would have paid tax on both their individual earnings and pension contributions.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that paying tax on private and other pensions unnecessarily penalises people who may have no other source of income after they retire.

We therefore call upon the British Government to immediately legislate to remove the requirement for people to pay tax on their pensions.

attributes.action: Get compensation from the Government for the Immigration (Windrush) Victims
attributes.background: The people who have been threatened with deportation, who have lost wages and jobs and the stress of having to apply for citizenship in a country (GB) where they understood they had a right to stay. The Government has not kept the records pre-1973. That is a failure on the Government's part .
attributes.additional_details: I have lived here for 61 years, worked, paid tax, married, passed my driving test etc.  I was never questioned re my Canadian birth cert, I arrived here on my mother's Passport as she returned to England after my Fathers death in Canada 1956. My father fought in the last world war as a volunteer. I have always known I had an independent right to stay. I have now had to apply for citizenship, been stopped from working for 15 months. Loss of earnings is debilitating. I am stressed out and angry.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Tax manufacturers and suppliers distributing Single Use Plastics beyond 2020
attributes.background: Following the success of documentaries such as Blue Planet, it has become clearer the deadly state single use plastics has on our environment. The government should look at taxing the problem at source to encourage companies to research breakthrough in sustainable, biodegradable alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.plasticfreechallenge.org/what-is-single-use-plastic/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-45232167

https://ieep.eu/archive_uploads/2128/IEEP_ACES_Product_Fiche_Single_Use_Plastics_Final_October_2016.pdf

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-08-29/blue-planet-2-plastic-waste-final-episode/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/abcnews.go.com/amp/International/great-pacific-garbage-patch-massive-floating-island-plastic/story%3fid=53962147

attributes.action: Have a referendum to devolve Yorkshire into a country.
attributes.background: As a student in the heart of Yorkshire, I believe it is the fundamental right for citizens of Yorkshire to have greater power over their society, economy and environment.
attributes.additional_details: This is why I am proposing to start a referendum to decide whether the people of Yorkshire want to be independent from England but remain in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Have another vote on leaving the EU. Canada-style agreement or no deal?
attributes.background: If the Chequers agreement is rejected, I feel the people should have a vote on what happens next, which is why I feel we should get a vote on the UK and EU agreeing an EU/Canada-style comprehensive economic and trade agreement or no deal.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Introduce a benefit payment to all diagnosis of cancer patients
attributes.background: When you are diagnosed with cancer your world is turned upside down for the patient and there familys many cancer victims are off work for long periods of time with no help from the government am asking the government to provide a benefit to help them fight this awful disease and make life easier
attributes.additional_details: Cancer is a five year programme and can return at anyone point during the five years

attributes.action: Legalise the usage and possession of Psychedelic drugs.
attributes.background:
There is astounding reports of these substances changing many people's lives, tackling depression and mental health issues.
We would like the laws reevaluated in order for proper clinical testing to take place.
We believe these substances will have a great impact in the field of psychiatry.
attributes.additional_details:
Dimethyltryptamine is a naturally occurring chemical in all of nature's plants. The human body is said to possibly produce this chemical and we currently do not know enough about this substance due to its legal status.

Research needs to be done into the potential medicinal benefits of this substance to tackle chronic depression etc.

attributes.action: Increase the lowest maintenance loans from student finance.
attributes.background: This petition sets out to up the lowest maintenance loan but keep the highest loan where it is. Many students struggle with what they receive.
attributes.additional_details: The lowest loan you can get whilst living on your own is around £4000 a year, for me, this was not even enough to cover just my rent let alone food. Many people find themselves in the same situation where they struggle to get by and are forced to basically live on the breadline by the government. The minimum loan should be upped to £5500 to avoid students getting into their overdraft and debt before even leaving university to enter the working world.

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: British National (Overseas) Citizens should be given full British Citizenship.
attributes.background: People in Hong Kong who hold the British National (Overseas) passport are British; however, the British government is refusing and avoiding giving these Hong Kongers the right of abode in the United Kingdom nor in any of the British territories. Many of them were forced to become PROC Chinese.
attributes.additional_details: The Chinese government is ignoring the Sino Anglo Agreements signed in 1981. It could be a disaster if we keep ignoring this is happening. Hong Kongers will come in as political refugees. We will need a lot of effort to house them and bad for the British reputations to the International community then.

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive 4 yearly instalments of their maintenance loan.
attributes.background: Most academic years of degrees start at mid to late September and end in May meaning three yearly instalments is ok for them. Nursing students don't end until August and start their next year in the same month! They are expected to survive on the same as those who aren't in the same situations.
attributes.additional_details: Three instalments does not give a student nurse enough support to fund their accommodation or basic health and wellbeing!

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".

attributes.action: Abolish the "Dangerous dogs act 1991" and replace it with a licence to keep dogs
attributes.background:
The so called dangerous dogs act was created in haste and without much research on the dogs themselves.

I feel any respectful owner would happily pay a 1 off fee to keep a family dog(s) and hopefully keep them from falling into the wrong hands, please sign this petition to legalise these breeds
attributes.additional_details:
Small dogs are generally more agressive than any large breed, Chihuahuas are recorded with most bites but they dont do as much damage as a large breed and this is deemed to be acceptable which it is not.

Pitbulls are caring, loving, faithful family dogs where in America they are effectionally known as the "nanny dog"

Pitbulls in the uk are a very misunderstood breed and have been stigmatized because of small minded individuals that used these dogs in the wrong setting i.e fighting

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rat poison to prevent its misuse to protect other animals
attributes.background: There are frequent cases of the misuse of rat poison resulting in the poisoning of dogs, cats and other animals. There are other ways in which rats can be controlled so I would like to see the sale and use of Rat Poison banned.
attributes.additional_details: A simple search of the internet will find multiple cases.

attributes.action: Maternity hospitals to have separate buildings for parents of baby loss
attributes.background: Parents who are suffering baby loss whether it be miscarriage, still birth or ectopic, shouldn't have to go through the maternity hospital to get checked out or give birth. Many hospitals have separate wings but you're still in the maternity hospital which is full of babies, pregnancy and reminders.

attributes.action: The country needs more Social Housing
attributes.background: In London the average waiting time for Social Housing is 10 years. For families that are in financial difficulties, this is a long wait. They will be moved around areas,moving from one temporary property to another. To fix this issue we need more Social housing across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Guardian: The idea of affordable housing has been 'twisted and out of shape'

attributes.action: To raise the issue of forced marriages with the governments of other countries.
attributes.background: me and some other students are doing a citizenship campaign and one of the things we need to is take action. the rates of forced marriage in other countries are very high and we would like to make a change.

attributes.action: Increase the VAT threshold for small businesses.
attributes.background: As a small business that operates on a purely residential basis - in private homes where any added VAT is not claimed back by home owners - I feel that all small businesses would benefit from a raised VAT cap which would allow them to grow and would boost the economy further.
attributes.additional_details: Small companies make up 96% of the business in the UK and contribute to 33% of employment and 22% of turnover. I feel that if small companies - specifically ones that cater purely to the needs of private households where added VAT is only a hinderance for all involved - had an increased VAT threshold of anywhere between £110,000-£150,000 then they would be encouraged to grow and in doing so support the UK economy even more.

attributes.action: Make it requirement for takeaways & restaurants to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background: As a country we should enforce ALL places where food is handled to display their food hygiene rating. Food hygiene is crucial and diseases and infections can occur from "poor hygiene" - we as paying customers have the right to know how hygienic our food is respectively.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a known fact that poor food hygiene is associated with serious cases of food poisoning and this could mean having to seek medical evaluation, if you have ever suffered from this you would know it is an unpleasant experience, and it is commonly associated with with pathogens such as Salmonella.
As paying customers we deserve the right to know the standard of hygiene that out food was prepared in respectively. 
This should also motivate those poor establishments to up their standards.

attributes.action: To allow Tyler, the Creator back into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In 2015, Tyler, the Creator (an American rapper) was banned from the United Kingdom on “behaviours unacceptable in the UK.” People make mistakes especially at a young age. What Tyler promotes is music which people adore and has matured as most people do. He's been banned from lyrics he wrote in 2009
attributes.additional_details: Tyler has changed as seen in his new music and album released in 2017, which is appealing to at least many thousands of fans in the United Kingdom and does not promote violence as he does not ever promote or perform those songs. His punishment has been too extreme for someone who has used ill lyrics at a poor time which many other celebrities have used worse. The people of the United Kingdom want to see him perform again.

attributes.action: Abolish university fees
attributes.background: We want to abolish university fees as they are causing people to miss out on education and potentially life changing careers. The fact that people cant get the proper education to become a doctor or lawyer etc. isn't fair as it means that only the wealthy can achieve the careers they want.
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees at public university are at the highest on average. This means that 17772 people can't afford to go to university. 

Since 1998 university fees have been drastically rising, starting at £1000 and then in 2006 they rose to £3000 and recently have been raised to £9000 a year on average.
